snippet.title: Schoolgirl approached by stranger in Barrack Heights
snippet.content:
Police are investigating after a 17-year-old girl was approached by a man in a red sedan in Barrack Heights on Friday. A 17-year-old girl was walking to school around 8.30am when the car pulled up alongside her in Keross Avenue, Barrack Heights. Police were told a man inside the red sedan, which had a black stripe down the driver's side and dark tinted windows, instructed her to get in.
She declined and continued to school where she alerted staff and police were contacted. The male is described as being aged in his thirties, with an olive complexion and wearing a grey jumper and sunglasses.
Anyone with information is urged to contact Lake Illawarra police on 42325599 or Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000
